1.Pros: i worked with friendly crew members
1.Cons: I was overworked and management was unorganized

2.Pros: Opportunities are always there to move up in the companyManagement Development program is worth 12 college credits towards a BAGreat BenefitsGood company valuesGreat food quality
2.Cons: Some times long hours, and working weekends and holidays, but after awhile you get used to have days off in the middle of the week.

4.Pros: Tuition Reimbursement, Language Assistance, Promotion Oppurtunity
4.Cons: Sporadic schedules, minimum wage, unrealistic expectations from management.

5.Pros: The co-workers are great. It's very much a family environment and the schedule is flexible between work and home life.
5.Cons: Poor training and poor communication between teams.

6.Pros: If you are looking for a job that is flexible and can offer lots of hours, McDonald's is great. The coworkers are fun to work with (in general), and you can get raises quickly as long as you are a motivated and hard worker.
6.Cons: Management is not helpful, and are largely unaware of problems in the restaurant and what needs to be fixed. You will have to work some pretty late nights and early mornings. Customers will not respect you. Generally, it is understaffed so you will have to juggle multiple tasks and jobs at once.

7.Summary: "Good start. But worth so much more"
7.Cons: Low wage, Losts of work OFF the clock. Many wage and hour violations.

8.Pros: Great benefits, clear vision, good team work, several resources available
8.Cons: Corporate lather, corporate politics almost always not based on results but on connections,

9.Pros: Good hours, will always have work
